preibisch_imagelib2.algorithm.gauss3

Interface ConvolverFactory<S,T>

  • Type Parameters:
    S -
    T -
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    ConvolverNativeType.ConvolverFactoryNativeType, ConvolverNativeTypeBuffered.ConvolverFactoryNativeTypeBuffered, ConvolverNumericType.ConvolverNumericTypeFactory

    public interface ConvolverFactory<S,T>
    ConvolverFactory creates 1-dimensional line convolvers. See create(double[], RandomAccess, RandomAccess, int, long).
    Author:
    Tobias Pietzsch

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      Runnable create(double[] halfkernel, RandomAccess<S> in, RandomAccess<T> out, int d, long lineLength)
      Create a 1-dimensional line convolver.

    • Method Detail

      • create

        Runnable create(double[] halfkernel,
                RandomAccess<S> in,
                RandomAccess<T> out,
                int d,
                long lineLength)
        Create a 1-dimensional line convolver. A line convolver has an input and an output RandomAccess. They are moved forwards a long a line in dimension d, reading source values from the input and writing convolved values to the output. The line convolver is a Runnable. The idea is to put the input and an output RandomAccess to the start of a line, then call Runnable.run() to do the convolution. Then the input and an output RandomAccess are moved to the next line, Runnable.run() is called again, and so on.
        Parameters:
        halfkernel - the upper half (starting at the center pixel) of the symmetric convolution kernel.
        in - RandomAccess on the source values.
        out - RandomAccess on the target (convolved) values.
        d - dimension in which to convolve.
        lineLength - how many convolved values to produce in one Runnable.run().
        Returns:
        a line convolver.
